website_summaries.verdict: An entry-level 2D and 3D home entertainment projector, the Acer H5380BD offers a low price, 720p HD resolution, and support for 3D with Blu-ray players and other video devices.
pros: HDMI port supports Mobile High-Definition Link (MHL) for easy connection to MHL-enabled mobile devices

customer_reviews.title: Blew up after one year and 5 weeks. Less than a quarter of the claimed bulb lifetime.
customer_reviews.text: It worked ok for one year and 5 weeks. Then we heard a loud pop and it went dark. The product spec said that the bulb lifetime was 5000 to 6000 hours. We did an absolute max 1500 hours and it is dead. Let us see what Acer customer support can do... So I called Acer customer service. Totally useless. Basically if you are out of warranty, even by 3 weeks there is no support. The bulb lifetime is definitely not what they indicated, at least in my case.
customer_reviews.author: Herve Borrel

customer_reviews.title: Awesome picture
customer_reviews.text: I set this up in my backyard on a white sheet for tailgates and movie nights. The "screen" is about 10 ft wide and the picture is crystal clear as soon as it is past dusk. Honestly, you can't beat the picture for the price. The only downside I've found so far is that the internal speaker is not super loud and while you can hook up an external audio, it needs to be hard-wired. If I had the purchase to make over again, I'd probably pay a bit more to have something bluetooth capable.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: After 2 fantastic years, HDMI input failed
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this projector. It works great day or night, Netflix looks like Blu-Ray, PS3 and Xbox 360 work great, and I even take (took) it outside for drive-in movies against the side of the barn. However, when I attempted to plug in an Apple 4K TV, the HDMI input failed, and now I might as well get a new one. Buy the protection plan!
customer_reviews.author: J Bo

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Projector
customer_reviews.text: I love my new Acer H5380BD 720p Home Theater Projector! I have been projecting it onto my wall and the picture is absolutely perfect, even if it is very bright outside. I have mine on a shelf above the couch about 11' from the wall and it's about a 90'' sized picture on the wall. Pros: Gorgeous picture Good sound from built in speaker Has audio out if you want to hook up your own speaker Allows for HDMI or Chromecast Remote works from pretty far away Portable and comes with bag Cons: You can hear the fan kick on when you first power it up but it's not super loud and at least you know its not overheating!
customer_reviews.author: love2surf

customer_reviews.title: Good projector for not a lot of money.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace my previous Acer projector which was just the older model. This is definitely an upgrade. Very, very bright so it's useable even with my lights on. I do wish there was a night shift setting though so the light didn't keep me wired when I'm trying to play games to relax in the evening.
customer_reviews.author: Liz C.

customer_reviews.title: Great projector for the price, better than LCD's
customer_reviews.text: Got this projector after seeing a friend's DLP and how amazing the picture was. I had bought an earlier Viewsonic DLP and the strobing/RBE on it was so terrible, I believed that I was not a candidate for DLP projectors. I owned an Epson for a couple years until buying an LG LED, which simply did not have enough lumens and screen size to make it bearable, so I sold it. This Acer is exactly what I want. I suppose what I needed was a home theater projector, not a business one, and the difference has worked wonders. Very little RBE and strobing effect here. I recommend this projector.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Crane

customer_reviews.title: No Rainbows For Me
customer_reviews.text: I was worried about the "rainbows" everyone else has talked about. I had a projector a couple years ago that had this problem, and I was able to see rainbows with the old one. But this projector, which cost me less than the old one, works better, is brighter, and doesn't have them (at least not to my eyes). With Amazon's lenient return policy, I pulled the trigger and tried this out. So if you're on the fence between this and a more expensive projector, just because of them rainbows, I'd recommend trying this one out first.
customer_reviews.author: Dawson

customer_reviews.title: I really enjoyed it all around
customer_reviews.text: Bought this about a month and a half ago. I really enjoyed it all around: nice and clear projection, easy to use, seemed fairly sturdy. I would have given this 4 or 5 stars except there was a popping sound and the bulb went out today. I haven't been able to open it up to have a look if it's just the bulb or something more, though there's a rattling sound that seems to be coming from the left side (not where the bulb is). I'm really hoping warranty covers this and will add a note later if all goes well. We used it less than 150 hours, easily which is way too short a life for a bulb.
customer_reviews.author: keira friesen

customer_reviews.title: Cool watching movies outside!
customer_reviews.text: Great unit, easy to use. As powerful as I've needed and a nice, crisp picture for outside viewing. I generally hook it up to my laptop via HDMI cable and use a 1/16th cable to connect to a small PA system. The built in speaker isn't really useful outside, probably fine for inside. Family watches movies outside regularly now. Had to wait until about 8:00 at the peak of summer because of brightness. Much earlier as fall approached. Still waiting to watch Aliens outside when the kids go to bed!
customer_reviews.author: vanoden

customer_reviews.title: Great quality home theatre
customer_reviews.text: We’ve used this for 5yrs. It has put up with my kids abuse for that long. Fortnite, everyday all summer long. The bulb just went, a new one is on the way. I can’t imagine a better deal for the $327 we paid for it.
customer_reviews.author: JMomi

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase, no regrets!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this projector to replace a older business projector I had to watch football games on a big screen in my warehouse, I am very, very happy with my purchase of this Acer. At first I was a little hesitant reading some reviews of how some can see rainbows with DLP projectors, I have noticed none. I am not a a/v snob who inspects every pixel, but the picture is great, sharp, bright etc and for the price and my use, it works great! I am sure you could spend double to triple the price for a projector that is 5% better, but I think that would be un-necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Pavman

customer_reviews.title: This is a great unit. I was worried 720p would not be ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great unit. I was worried 720p would not be clear but blu rays look stunning, I'm on a budget so forking over another $200 for 1080p was out of the question. I don't even have a screen, just use white wall. It has an audio out that has a variable volume so whatever speaker you connect you can adjust the volume with the Acer remote. You can buy a cheap Hdmi switch if you have more than one device. The only cons are the dark scenes the blacks are a little too black but it still looks better than my 1080p TV especially in well lit scenes.
customer_reviews.author: bugaloo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for home use.
customer_reviews.text: This projector has been up and running in my house for over a year now. Probably use it a few times a week to watch a movie or show, the picture is bright I even put it on a light brown wall and its difficult to tell it's not on a white wall. Have not had to replace the bulb yet. It gets hot when running so usually I give it 15-20 mins after shut down before I put it away in the bag it came with. The remote broke after a hard fall on a concrete floor, but I can hardly blame Acer for that, I found a reasonably priced replacement and have been more careful with it.
customer_reviews.author: jonnyweave

customer_reviews.title: the bulb is taking longer to acclimate than i like, but the picture is still decent
customer_reviews.text: we have used this thing almost every day for the last year. the bulb is taking longer to acclimate than i like, but the picture is still decent. if I go from a movie to the windows screen, it will take a few seconds to show words clearly. the bulb might be waring out, but I'm going to go as long as I can until it really annoys me before i change it.
customer_reviews.author: levi73044

customer_reviews.title: I love this projector
customer_reviews.text: I love this projector. I was looking to buy something to watch movies outside or inside in a large format. Most decent projectors were in the thousands, and after lots of research I came across this one. I hooked up a PS3 to it and played games in my backyard, projecting against the house. It's very bright, so the color you're projecting on doesn't seem to matter as much as I would have expected. I'm glad I purchased this one as I don't think there is a better one for the price.
customer_reviews.author: x0mb

customer_reviews.title: Use it as a home theater and I love it. Had to hook it up to my ...
customer_reviews.text: Use it as a home theater and I love it. Had to hook it up to my stereo system because the speakers on the unit are pretty bad, but the picture quality is impressive and it works great for watching movies and tv. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a home theatre projector, especially for the price! Just make sure you get some speakers for it.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price, most of the time.
customer_reviews.text: For me this projector was a great choice. It's cheaper then trying to get a TV anywhere close to this large. I enjoy watching TV/Movies on a large screen. That being said, the image quality isn't that good. Most of the time the projection being large makes up for the below average image quality. I say 'most of the time' because sometimes when there is a large area in which the color changes slowly (like fog or a smooth lake) I see an extremely noticeable transition. Instead of seeing a smooth gradient I see 4-5 areas of different colors.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: I should have listened to the reviews in the first place.
customer_reviews.text: This projector does live up to the online reviews. I initial bought an Optoma to replace my old Optoma (which I liked fine) and I wasn't happy with the quality nor the picture is made. When I finally settled on the Acer is was night and day difference on color and contrast out of the box. While you won't get colors to match an LCD screen you really don't have to tweak anything, I found the settings I liked in the modes provided. The triangle mounting holes were a little close together, so it took some work to get my universal mount to work, but I managed in the end. Great projector, I'm sold on Acer now.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew S. Benefiel

customer_reviews.title: The bar is set high with this one
customer_reviews.text: Great quality. I have it set up in my living room right next to my sliding door. I can use it throughout the day with the sun outside and it has very little affect on picture. I don't have to close the shudders and kill the lights to enjoy. I'm throwing it out to 100 inches and picture is great. I'm a cable tech and I know a good picture from a sub par. This projector is amazing for the price. So great my brother bought one after seeing my set up. I highly recommend it. 16x9 picture
customer_reviews.author: Douglas G Gary

customer_reviews.title: I love it!  Take it everywhere!
customer_reviews.text: I love it! I have a portable screen we take all over, friends house, camping, etc. We tried it out on our garage door and was surprisingly impressed! You can tune out the squares on the garage, most people wont care and just be amazed you are watching a movie theater sized movie or sporting game outside on your garage, lol. Walking dead nights outside are the best! Quality is great, be it a file from a pc, or cable/satellite provider.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hankus

customer_reviews.title: i love this projector
customer_reviews.text: i love this projector. use it every night. have it set up in my room. amazing picture. didn't even have to change the color of my wall since i can change the color of the projection to adjust for the red in my walls. also has a sleep timer so that's one of the main reasons i give it a 5
customer_reviews.author: Justin C.

customer_reviews.title: After 6 years of continual use, very happy with this projector.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this projector back in 2014 and are finally replacing the bulb 6 years later. We have a roku hooked up to it and use it as our main TV, so it gets hours of use everyday. Picture quality is great, even with low/mid level lighting conditions. I have a slightly older 3x more expensive projector and the picture quality/brightness is just as good. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: M. Dekkenga

customer_reviews.title: pretty good
customer_reviews.text: it focuses pretty clearly so you can read words. it's very bright even with lights on. picture quality is good. it heats up though but it doesn't really make any noise. built in speakers are horrible, you need to plug in external speakers. i really wish you didn't have to have a remote to adjust settings<-major downside, especially if you lose the remote. but this is a really good projector for the home use!
customer_reviews.author: ndrwum

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good -- but very strong "rainbow effect."
customer_reviews.text: Nice, sharp picture and vibrant color. And the 720p resolution is not terrible; up close you see the pixels, but 10 feet or more away you don't really notice them. But the "rainbow effect" is very strong with this one, and it was a deal-breaker for me. I returned it and bought another brand.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: ... 1080p projector I don't see how you'll do much better. Maybe a touch brighter would help but after ...
customer_reviews.text: Without forking the money out for a full 1080p projector I don't see how you'll do much better. Maybe a touch brighter would help but after taking the time to set it up colour, contrast, etc. This thing over performed in my books. I bought it due to some professional reviews elsewhere but couldn't be happier. Croods and Rise of the Guardians just pops off a flat white wall. I can only aging once I get the screen up how much better it will be.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good projector but buggy problem detecting the source.
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this projector twice (the first one was stolen). I was disappointed to find that the 2nd one seemed to have the same problem that I was putting up with from the first one. With both projectors, there seems to be an intermittent (yet pretty consistent) problem with recognizing the source. With the first one, we assumed it was the HDMI cable or the various computers or something in between. But the problem persists with this projector and we have had to switch to using a backup projector and the problem doesn't exist. So I'm disappointed to say that it seems the projector is the source of the problem. Repeatedly.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Williams

customer_reviews.title: Works great for our needs, inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, easy to set-up, light-weight, and keeps on providing nice picture for movies and presentations. :-)
customer_reviews.author: David Jackemeyer

customer_reviews.title: Great for yard viewing!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this unit for movie nights in the back yard, picture is clear and bright. It does need to be dark out to see clear picture but we expected that. We use external speakers which are easy to set up. Great design and functionality for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Daly

customer_reviews.title: the picture is great, the price is even better. can't beat it
customer_reviews.text: Almost sided with a cheap $250 projector from groupon...really glad I didn't. Set this up approx 12 feet away and was able to get a clear picture about 110" I was given a free curved screen but it's 4:3, luckily you can set the projector to that. So I'm at 85"now, more than enough still. I liked this one because of the contrast ratio. I can watch it with all the curtains opened and the lights on. This is an amazing unit for the price. I didn't cheap out on sound either which made this that much better. I'd highly recommend spending an extra $100 to $200 to obtain this kind of quality compared to those crap deals on groupon.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with this projector!
customer_reviews.text: We now have great family movie nights! I am very pleased with the picture quality and ease of setup. Pros: -Very nice 720p picture. -HDMI port available for connecting DVD/BluRay/game consoles/Chromecast/Amazon Fire Stick -Price point Cons: -Sound quality is not good, but I've worked around this by plugging it into my sound bar
customer_reviews.author: 808stu

customer_reviews.title: make sure you do not lose the remote or run out of batteries- or else you'll be holding a useless device.
customer_reviews.text: For the price, the picture is acceptable. I have no problem watching HD movies on it. The DLP RGB trails are very noticeable, though. My biggest complaint is that this thing cannot be operated without the remote control. Why would it be designed this way? I can't imagine that removing a physical interface saved much space. If you purchase this projector, make sure you do not lose the remote or run out of batteries- or else you'll be holding a useless device.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy H.

customer_reviews.title: Good projector.
customer_reviews.text: Bang for buck, this projector is pretty good. This is my first projector and I use it almost every day. I have it hooked up to one computer or another and it gives outstanding performance for its price. I paid $380 for mine when it was on sale, new condition.
customer_reviews.author: Maynard Waterhead

customer_reviews.title: Nice unit
customer_reviews.text: Long throw focus. If you need a projector for up close projecting, like within ten or fifteen feet, get a companion model that is "short throw." This one is great for projecting from the back of a room or even in a small theater. It works great and has given me no problems... except that I have to move it farther back from the screen/ surface than where I am standing and speaking.
customer_reviews.author: Marc C. Waszkiewicz

customer_reviews.title: I can't find anything I don't like about it
customer_reviews.text: If you are thinking about this projector just buy it right now. I researched for weeks before buying this projector. I can't find anything I don't like about it. Sports look great, video games are great, movies are great. Everything is great. Everyone that comes to our house thinks we have spent thousands on a projector when we spent a fraction of that on this one. It's amazing. Just buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Rife

customer_reviews.title: Horrible.
customer_reviews.text: Horrible. And still waiting for my FULL refund from company.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Grant Rankin

customer_reviews.title: Better then expected
customer_reviews.text: Way better then expected. My first projector, and I use it only for movies and games. I display directly on the wall. Image is really good. From about 5 ft it cover most of the wall. The fan is a bit noisy and it generates some heat, like a normal laptop when used intensively.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Projector!!!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome projector. I wanted a 2nd projector for my Man Cave garage and could not be happier. Very bright very good color reproduction. I have a Viewsonic 1080P in my basement theater to compare it to.. This Acer projector does not make much fan noise at all, especially in ECO mode. I do not see any of the Rainbow effects. I have set all my equipment to output to 720P. (BluRay Player and TWC box). I caught this on sale from the DEAL OF THE DAY at $299 and was very impressed. You will not be disappointed...
customer_reviews.author: J.P.

customer_reviews.title: They work great, except for one little annoyance
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these, one permanently mounted, and the other is for travel. They work great, except for one little annoyance: When using a 30ft HDMI cable, it will not connect to an iPhone via a "Lightning Digital AV Adapter". Short cables work fine, and other devices work too. It's just the Lightning -> HDMI 30' cable. Great value for money though.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Sherman

customer_reviews.title: YES!!!
customer_reviews.text: Christmas present for the hubby and we LOVE it!! We love that we can move it from outside to inside easily. We also bought a PA system to hook up to it for better sound. We prefer watching movies/shows on this compared to our TV. Great purchase :)
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I used the Acer H5380BD for a year and a half and was satisfied. I moved often for work, and this was a great portable alternative to a HDTV. I ran video from Xbox 360 via VGA, and Chromecast and MacBook via HDMI. I preferred to run 1080i over 720p, but the quality is excellent at both resolutions, with either input, and on a wide range of surfaces from varying distances. I have not noticed a "rainbow effect." The built in speaker is underpowered, so I used a Jawbone Jambox with the 3.5mm audio out. If I was buying a projector today, I would buy the H5380BD.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Great picture and brightness but needs a big room
customer_reviews.text: Amazing projector but needs to be a ways away from the wall/screen to get very big. The picture quality and brightness are great even form long distances. You might have issues in a small room as it will not get that big. I added a Chromecast to the HDMI port and now have a wireless projector.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Davis

customer_reviews.title: But the picture quality is VERY good on my 100-inch screen
customer_reviews.text: I use this strictly for playing​ games on my PS4 in a darkened basement. This will not fare well in a lighted environment. To get that capability, you'd have to spend twice the amount. But the picture quality is VERY good on my 100-inch screen.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Fisher

customer_reviews.title: It was really great for the kids
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this for my tv for a year now. The picture has been dim for a few months, and yesterday the bulb exploded. The hours are a little over 3500, so much less than advertised. Replacement bulb is expensive, almost half of what I paid for the projector new. It was really great for the kids, and bright for the first half of its life. I personally couldn't watch movies projected by it due to the annoying rainbow effect.
customer_reviews.author: angryandroid

customer_reviews.title: The lamp was about 3000hrs old already and I made like about another 1500hrs on this projector before the color ...
customer_reviews.text: I had old Acer X1161P projector that I bought second hand for $50 in working condition. The lamp was about 3000hrs old already and I made like about another 1500hrs on this projector before the color wheel die. I replaced color wheel and still was working for another 300hrs. Anyways I bought this projector and I was amazed what a quality picture and screen size! I recommend this product it works well in very light room!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... that the 720 resolution was going to make things annoying chunky, but you know what
customer_reviews.text: I was worried that the 720 resolution was going to make things annoying chunky, but you know what? It's fine. I even picked up a cheap Sony 3D BluRay player and a pair of 3D DP-LINK active 3D glasses, and my home theatre is now in the third dimension!
customer_reviews.author: J. T. Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Great Projector
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this product for over a year now and it is great. We have blown up the screen to a size of 8 feet in length and the quality is still amazing! So impressed with this product.
customer_reviews.author: vsandefur

customer_reviews.title: Worth it if you've got different speaker option.
customer_reviews.text: I have this hooked up to my ps4, xbox one, and amazon TV. It works perfectly for all of that. Great picture quality. Does ok with picture when it's somewhat light out, but it could be better. The speaker on it isn't the best so I went ahead and figured out how to connect my surround sound and now it's like I'm in my own movie theater.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas Stoflet

customer_reviews.title: I was skeptical but am glad with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical but am glad with this purchase. I came home to my husband and son watching a movie in the middle of the day. The sun was still out and they only had the shades closed. The projector is bright!
customer_reviews.author: Wonder

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Projector
customer_reviews.text: This was my first projector and was a little sceptical. Love it so far. Colors are great and the resolutions looks sharp for 720p. The picture I took is from outside against my garage wall. Also using a mini USB male to micro USB male adapter with a Roku/Chromecast/fire stick to the projectors mini USB doesn't work
customer_reviews.author: M. Pena

customer_reviews.title: Spend the extra money to get a 1080p projector!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this projector in 2014 and still use it to this day. I wish i had invested the extra hundred dollars to get a 1080p projector rather than this 720p projector. Positives: affordable price, large screen size, decent quality. Negatives: bulb life is short (burnt out after a year, cost about $150 to replace)
customer_reviews.author: Brett Rissmiller

customer_reviews.title: and im glad i got it
customer_reviews.text: i have had this for a few days now . and im glad i got it.got it for $369 for a 720 native resolution this projector rocks it throws a picture on gray wall the wall is my screen the screen is 72 inch screen ( 6 ft ) im never going back to flat screen tv thank you amazon
customer_reviews.author: Richard L. Embree

customer_reviews.title: Got this at a steal for 350$ Works great and is very bright with a high quality HD ...
customer_reviews.text: Got this at a steal for 350$ Works great and is very bright with a high quality HD image. Haven't really noticed to much rainbow either. The speaker isn't very good though so its recommended to get better ones.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Quesada

customer_reviews.title: Great projector. Very bright
customer_reviews.text: Great projector. Very bright, completely worth it. My only complaint is that proper color calibration is not easy and a must. The idea of having everything on the remote control is a risky take but not a problem for me. I'm using it with a 25mt HDMI cable connected to a Yamaha receiver without any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Gio

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! First projector, but I get nothing but compliments from people who've seen the quality. It was my first addition to my new movie room/game room.
customer_reviews.author: Mike L

customer_reviews.title: Bright and Crisp computer projector, shows code and text pretty well too.
customer_reviews.text: Great projector, great price! Very bright and it shows computer code/text perfectly, crystal clear at pretty high resolution too. Also this projector is cheap at about $450. Great product we bought three of them and love them!
customer_reviews.author: William G.

customer_reviews.title: Great Projector!
customer_reviews.text: Use it for movies and the kids have had friends over and projected their gaming. No complaints!
customer_reviews.author: Shari

customer_reviews.title: This projector has been awesome for outdoor movie nights
customer_reviews.text: This projector has been awesome for outdoor movie nights. Crystal clear image in the dark. Inside you would need a dark room in order to get the most from it.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Good entry level projector.
customer_reviews.text: Great bang for your buck if your getting into projectors. We set ours up outside for outdoor movie night. I recommend buying speakers internal speakers suck.
customer_reviews.author: Ron R

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy, good price
customer_reviews.text: Bought this projector for main living room, have it hooked up to surround sound system to control which HDMI it is using. Excellent, sharp picture, bright colors, I would definitely recommend and may buy another! Use it for watching cable, sports, gaming, Blu-Ray movies, does not disappoint, and for this price waaaay cheaper than buying a big screen TV when all you need is a wall. I have mine mounted to get the perfect angle.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Swanson

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Really great quality. Speakers are not great but you usually would hook it up to your external speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Uy

customer_reviews.title: Great buy awesome picture!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first projector bought it for the office and presentations had it shipped home and decided to open it up and go ahead and set it up. Wow...kids might not want to watch a tv again.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality for price range
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality for price range. I use it on a 120" screen and I am very pleased. Multiple people have commented on how well the picture looks while watching movies and sporting events. I am very happy with my purchase and will buy this again if I ever need another projector.
customer_reviews.author: Morgen

customer_reviews.title: 720 my a%#.....looks like more 1080
customer_reviews.text: amazing pic... I have a benq1075 on a 10ft screen in my mancave... and I'm still trying to figure out the $400 difference between the two.. I recently bought this one for a cheaper projector for outside movie night. I have it display on the back of my garage and it is on a 6.5ft by 12ft sheets of drywall and the picture is perfect..
customer_reviews.author: Jake F.

customer_reviews.title: Never going back to flat screen tvs
customer_reviews.text: Had this for about 7 months now and I wanted to wait until I had really experienced it to write a review. I use this for presentations at work and for a home theater system. It is easy to set up and adjust the picture. You want to be as straight on as possible to make sure the picture is not distorted. HD quality picture, not a single issue so far, runs quite, just great overall product. I had a superbowl party this year at my house and the 80" tv projected on the wall of my living room was a huge hit! 100% recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: john anthony

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Looks great on the wall. Wish I had more customization setting for when I'm at an angle to the side and/or shooting up/down. Otherwise, very simple to use and pretty intuitive.
customer_reviews.author: Cody Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Works great and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Works great and easy to use. Bright with good color and contrast. As noted elsewhere, there is only one button on the projector that turns it on/off and changes input source. Otherwise, all controls are on the remote so if the remote is lost or batteries are dead, can't control the projector at all. No paper instruction manual included. Have to view or download it from website.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best value projector out there!! Couldn't be happier
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed with this projector. It is plenty bright even during the day with blinds closed, lights on, and a display diagonal size of probably 100". Also great resolution- 720p is plenty especially from 10-15 feet or more away.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Work great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Have purchased 3 for my church and they work very good for our building and price range.
customer_reviews.author: Will Johns

customer_reviews.title: Fan isn't too loud and the picture is great!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a fairly cheap projector for my girlfriend as a gift. This one went on sale and I snatched it up. Works incredibly well! Fan isn't too loud and the picture is great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: great entry level projector. No issues. Speakers aren't half bad. Love this projector more and more. PIcture quality is good and the brightness is over the top.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Tennill

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Projector
customer_reviews.text: The best projector for the price.. Clear images, a lot of settings to adjust the image for the best reproduction.. The 3d effect its perfect in my opinion.. I recommend this product..
customer_reviews.author: Richard Marfisi

customer_reviews.title: Unreal
customer_reviews.text: This projector is honestly amazing. I can not believe I got this lucky with such a steal. Everyone in my house loves it
customer_reviews.author: Youssef Jalloul

customer_reviews.title: Thanks for the great comments from Amazon which enabled me to buy this ...
customer_reviews.text: Thanks for the great comments from Amazon which enabled me to buy this amazing projector. i played 1080p videos no grain and wonderful picture even in day light. my whole family is amazed. best purchase , worth every penny. don't spend 1000+ for a 1080p, this will do the job. only pros no cons for me. Keep it up Amazon and ACER
customer_reviews.author: Krishnan Sampath

customer_reviews.title: Works beautifully. Yes
customer_reviews.text: Works beautifully. Yes, I probably would have preferred 1080p, but for the price the quality can't be beat. Also works very well in conjunction with my harmony remote.
customer_reviews.author: Stephan Matanovic

customer_reviews.title: Great projector. Just started using this week and it ...
customer_reviews.text: Great projector. Just started using this week and it has a great picture that is extremely bright, even with some ambient light in the room. I'm currently using it to get a 72" screen from around 9' away. Only flaw is that the speakers aren't too great but that should be fully expected considering the price, plus it has an aux out so you can always hook it up to other speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Geoff S.

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal
customer_reviews.text: Using a TV all my life and having a relatively small apartment, I was afraid to get a projector. Well, the gamble paid off and I am never going back to TV again. I have this connected to my computer with Prime video and it is great. I guess it does 3D too but I have not gotten there yet, but plan to. Attached photos taken during day with sunlight entering a large balcony door with shades drawn. Only downside is that it does not come with a lens cap. Also, avoid looking accidentally into it because it is blinding! I'd rather look at the sun!
customer_reviews.author: RealReviews

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for the price
customer_reviews.text: Awesome for the price. Would sometimes freeze the display if manually setting the 3D mode to side by side. Pressing the freeze display and then back again fixes it.
customer_reviews.author: shredder

customer_reviews.title: I have over 101" cast onto a wall in my living room and its a great picture with the curtains drawn on a sunny day
customer_reviews.text: I have had this projector for more than a year and its still going strong. I have over 101" cast onto a wall in my living room and its a great picture with the curtains drawn on a sunny day. I don't have an actual screen put the picture is phenomenal even with the walls gold/creme color. Can not express enough how great of projector this little guy is.
customer_reviews.author: Nakao M Mauch

customer_reviews.title: Image Quality of a 4K YouTube video
customer_reviews.text: Received the Acer H5380BD HT projector just before the year end. I am quite happy with the quality of the image. I pulled up a 4K video on youtube and recorded the image quality . Here you go.
customer_reviews.author: chandan

customer_reviews.title: Great for family entertaining.
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly. We attach computer and a blue tooth audio source and have watched movies on the wall and outside on the white siding. I have not purchased a screen yet.
customer_reviews.author: D.O.G.

customer_reviews.title: 3D Home Theater!
customer_reviews.text: This is fantastic! A year ago I considered spending more than 5 times the price, but this one has more features and brighter projection than what I was looking at then. And 3D!
customer_reviews.author: Lucy Lou

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Pros - clear picture, great contrast and brightness even during the day and works as advertised. Con - Throw from short distance does not yield desirable size. I will recommend this to others.
customer_reviews.author: Conscious Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome - Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from a Sharp XR-30S and I couldn't be happier. I was doing a search for best projectors under $500 and came across this review site (, which listed this model as the best. Read it for yourself... Picture is very clear and bright, even with all the lights on. Football in HD is fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Larsen

customer_reviews.title: Amazing except for the speaker but I hook it up ...
customer_reviews.text: Amazing except for the speaker but I hook it up to my Sonos and do movie nights on the backyard and the family and friends love it.
customer_reviews.author: Captain M

customer_reviews.title: Does a fair job at automatically squaring the thrown picture ...
customer_reviews.text: Does a fair job at automatically squaring the thrown picture on the wall, from whatever angle of tilt it is left in (not left/right, but up/down...which i call tilt)
customer_reviews.author: amazoncassius

customer_reviews.title: Excellent projector for the price
customer_reviews.text: Excellent projector for the price. Very bright so you can view it in not so dark rooms to. Would have been nice if had horizontal keystone too
customer_reviews.author: Deeps

customer_reviews.title: I couldn't be happier with it at that price
customer_reviews.text: I got this for under $300 as a deal of the day. I couldn't be happier with it at that price.
customer_reviews.author: Brian E. Adler

customer_reviews.title: For the price and being able to have ten feet of screen I am happy but I would/will definitely spend more next time and ...
customer_reviews.text: After using this projector for a number of months I give it 3 stars. It is very loud and not as bright as other projectors I have seen. I have it set up on a 10' screen in my living room and it serves its purpose. For the price and being able to have ten feet of screen I am happy but I would/will definitely spend more next time and get something of higher quality. Also only having one HDMI port is very annoying.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: can't beat it. buy it.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing. Great picture quality, easy to use. Even does 3D! for this price you can't beat this. buy it now.
customer_reviews.author: Graham

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: bought it for our son's new home and it's a huge hit
customer_reviews.author: D. Walczak

customer_reviews.title: Been a great addition to the outside deck
customer_reviews.text: Been a great addition to the outside deck. I throw it up on an 11/9 white tarp connected with zip ties to eye hooks on the house. Neighborhood movie nights all summer. Plenty of light for outdoor movies once dusk hits.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't know much about projectors... just wanted ...
customer_reviews.text: Don't know much about projectors...just wanted to watch movies on the big screen. This one did the trick. The sound is okay, but you'll need speakers for sure.
customer_reviews.author: The Grafters

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: Great projector! Even on colored walls, this projector shows a great picture!
customer_reviews.author: Dave Wall

customer_reviews.title: Better than a flat screen
customer_reviews.text: I don't notice the fan noise when watching, picture clarity is amazing, and it works in moderately lit rooms. I shine it on a textured white wall and can't even tell it is textured. I would definitely choose this over any flat screen TV.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Kuhn

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great projector with a lot of extras for the money
customer_reviews.author: Musichead

customer_reviews.title: This is the one!
customer_reviews.text: Did quite a bit of research before purchasing, and we are very satisfied with our decision! For the price, the picture quality is great (even in a lit room)! Getting an 100 inch screen from roughly 11-12 feet, and no noticeable pixels unless your face is pressed against the image. Packaged well. Hot, but nothing crazy. Silent. Buy this if you don't have the budget to go to 1080!
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: it was a great projector for its price
customer_reviews.text: Had some issues with the picture quality. Anytime it would show a blue sky, the image would get pixilated. Other than that, it was a great projector for its price.
customer_reviews.author: Ahmad H.

customer_reviews.title: Rated 720p but at the right distance and the right ...
customer_reviews.text: Rated 720p but at the right distance and the right screen.. Can't tell much or a difference between 1080p. Blown away with the picture quality.
customer_reviews.author: TheronCulp

customer_reviews.title: Unbeatable for the price
customer_reviews.text: I want to give this projector 4 stars but the price is just too good for this machine. Got it for 450 about. There are a few cons. It runs kind of loud on non-eco mode. It is not 1080p. There is no lens shift. However all these things are to be expected in the sub-1000 dollar category. The pros of this projector are so many. It is super bright, has great contrast. Very light and thus easy to pick up. it came with a carrying case too. It is 3d capable and has low latency which is important for gaming. I brought it to my friends place and they loved it. Highly recommended for entry level projector owners
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Buy it now
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, we'll worth the money. Better quality than most $600+ views on ic models
customer_reviews.author: Conrad friess

product_meta.title: Acer H5380BD 720p Home Theater Projector
product_meta.description: Style:3000 LumensThe Acer H5380BD Projector brings movie quality projection with rich details, bright and natural colors and exceptional contrast. Color performance is enhanced on any surface, even colored walls through Acer"s eColor Boost II+ technology and wall-color compensation, while ColorSafe II prevents color decay resulting from extended use of the projector. Handy installation utilities make setting up easy, and power-management solutions yield great energy savings while conserving the earth"s resources.
feature_bullets: Native 720p widescreen resolution delivers a true cinematic experience for the latest high-def content. It is the perfect fit for widescreen movies created in Blu-ray Disc and HDTV formats.
The cutting-edge Dust Shield Solution technology is a cost-effective system to protect projectors from damage caused by airborne dust and sand.
Equipped with at least two connectors for multiple-PC source input, including D-Sub and HDMI, offering more flexible connectivity and instant switching.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars264 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
